title: ELCIDIS
text:
The ELCIDIS (Electric vehicle City Distribution) project ran between about 1989 and 2002 was initiated by <a href="CITELEC">CITELEC</a> (the European Association of cities interested in electric vehicles), and was approved for funding under the Energy Programme of the <a href="European%20Commission">European Commission</a>.
the project involved 6 European cities: 
There was also observers from <a href="Belgium">Belgium</a>, <a href="England">England</a>, <a href="Ireland">Ireland</a>, <a href="Switzerland">Switzerland</a> and <a href="Monaco">Monaco</a>.
ELCIDIS experimented with a varied selection of <a href="battery%20electric%20vehicles">battery electric vehicles</a> and <a href="hybrid%20electric%20vehicles">hybrid electric vehicles</a>, mostly <a href="light%20truck">light truck</a>s and <a href="van">van</a>s for local deliveries combined with an urban <a href="distribution%20center">distribution center</a> (UDC) to interconnect with conventional distribution networks for perishable consumer goods.
